summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, asserting the writer's long-term friendship with Maxwell, vouching for her character, and denying she poses a danger to children or is a flight risk.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case in the Southern District of New York, to whom this character reference letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail application and character reference; the writer describes her as a long-time close friend, honest, and not a danger to children or flight risk.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and is the recipient of this bail application support letter.

events.title: Bail Application Submission
events.description: A character reference letter is submitted to Judge Alison Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, arguing she is not a flight risk or danger to children.

locations: United States Courthouse, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a character reference letter supporting Ghislaine Maxwell's 2020 bail application, addressed to Judge Alison Nathan.
The writer claims a decades-long close friendship with Maxwell and her immediate family, socializing regularly.
The writer asserts Maxwell is honest, poses no danger to children, is not a flight risk, and should be granted bail to prepare her defense.
The writer mentions Maxwell has faced 'monstrous allegations in the press' that forced her to worry about her safety.
The writer offers to provide a financial surety to meet any bail pledge the court may set.
